original_title: Increasing reserve assets enhance confidence in overall growth strategy – Semasinghe
original_body_lines: Sri Lanka’s Official Reserve has indicated a substantial increase, rising by 23.2% to USD 4.4 billion in December 2023.
Accordingly, Sri Lanka’s Official Reserve rose to USD 4.4 billion in December 2023, compared to the USD 3.57 billion earned in November.

Commenting on the increase, State Minister of Finance Shehan Semasinghe stated that the increase in the country’s Official Reserve suggests a positive economic development, and enhances confidence on the overall growth strategy.
